issue.title: TypeError null is not an object (evaluating 'e.value.groupType')

labels.name: bug
labels.description: broken functionality, usability problems, unexpected errors

labels.name: ios
labels.description: issues that concern the ios client but not all clients

issue.body:
```
Client: ios
Tutanota version: 3.118.22
User agent:
Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 17_2 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/15E148
TypeError
Error message: null is not an object (evaluating 'e.value.groupType')
Stacktrace:
@asset://app/worker-search-857a3533.js:1:48128
map@[native code]
@asset://app/worker-search-857a3533.js:1:48097
```

The issue occurs here:

https://github.com/tutao/tutanota/blob/46d7f74bf2eaeba6bfa1e96f9645f6f393e4ccca/src/api/worker/search/Indexer.ts#L372C4-L415

I suspect it has something to do with iOS 17

issue.title: Uncaught Error: Illegal key length: 0 (expected: 256)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: broken functionality, usability problems, unexpected errors

issue.body:
Happens to linux users that use kwallet for secret storage:

> yes, we had issues with kwallet not providing or incorrectly implementing the org.freedesktop.secrets DBus API that we require to store the key that encrypts the stored credentials. The client will generate the key, store it and then get a zero-length key back when asking for it on next startup.
> 
> The gnome-keyring package usually works out of the box for this purpose, but I understand that installing it is not always an option. We have some information about this in our FAQ at https://tutanota.com/de/faq/#secretstorage and in our issue tracker (You should find relevant discussions if you search for KDE or Kwallet in the closed and open issues).

```
Client: linux
Type: FREE
Tutanota version: 3.105.9
Timestamp (UTC): Mon, 19 Dec 2022 09:33:35 GMT
User agent:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) tutanota-desktop/3.105.9 Chrome/108.0.5359.62 Electron/22.0.0 Safari/537.36
Error
Error message: Illegal key length: 0 (expected: 256)
Stacktrace:
Error: Illegal key length: 0 (expected: 256)
at ti (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:383863)
at Xn (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:382991)
at Object.aes256Encrypt (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:710037)
at Object.aesEncryptObject (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:13:141693)
at Be._setEncryptedVar (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:23244)
at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
at async Be.setVar (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:23504)
at async Vy.storePushIdentifierLocally (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:808083)
at async ipc (/opt/tutanota-desktop/resources/app.asar/desktop/DesktopMain.js:1:810473
```

comment.body: Another user reporting the same issue with KWallet version 23.08.2 (KDE 5.27.8), switching to KeepassXC helped

issue.title: App Freeze Android 13, when opening a email or clicking settings cog

labels.name: bug
labels.description: broken functionality, usability problems, unexpected errors

issue.body:
**Bug in mobile app**

**Describe the bug**
App becomes unresponsive when do anything.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to open email
2. App becomes unresponsive.
3. Stuck Loading...

**Expected behavior**
Not to freeze.

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**
 - Brand: Motorola
 - OS: Android 13
 - Version: Latest 3.118.22

comment.body: Thank you for the report, is there any more info you could provide? WebView version, screen recording, anything would help tbh

issue.title: Update alarm permissions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: broken functionality, usability problems, unexpected errors

labels.name: android
labels.description: issues that concern the android client but not all clients

issue.body:
> [SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission#SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM), the permission introduced in Android 12 for apps to schedule exact alarms, is no longer being pre-granted to most newly installed apps targeting Android 13 and higher (will be set to denied by default)

However I think we should instead of asking for alarms just ask for `USE_EXACT_ALARM` permission:

>  [Calendar or alarm clock apps](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/12253906#exact_alarm_preview) need to send calendar reminders, wake-up alarms, or alerts when the app is no longer running. These apps can request the [USE_EXACT_ALARM](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission#USE_EXACT_ALARM) normal permission. The USE_EXACT_ALARM permission will be granted on install, and apps holding this permission will be able to schedule exact alarms just like apps with the [SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission#SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM) permission.

But as far as I understand Google will manually approve the apps that request this

more info: https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/changes/schedule-exact-alarms

pull_request.title: New website domain
pull_request.body:
Change occurrences of the old domain (tutanota.com) by the new domain (tuta.com).
This includes csp for the app html, the support entries and policy docs

implements #5929

repo.name: tutanota
repo.description: Tutanota is an email service with a strong focus on security and privacy that lets you encrypt emails, contacts and calendar entries on all your devices.

repo.name: tutanota
repo.description: Tutanota is an email service with a strong focus on security and privacy that lets you encrypt emails, contacts and calendar entries on all your devices.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,10 +1,23 @@
 global.window = undefined
 
 function getCspUrls(env) {
+	// we want to have the following allowed connect-src for a given staticUrl like https://app(.local/.test).tuta.com:
+	//
+	// wss://app(.local/.test).tuta.com for websocket
+	// http(s)://*.api(.local/.test).tuta.com for the web app
+	// api://app(.local/.test).tuta.com for the mobile apps api protocol (intercepted by native part)
+	// https://app(.local/.test).tuta.com for the staticUrl itself
+	// https://(local./test.)tuta.com for the website
 	if (env.staticUrl) {
 		const staticUrlParts = env.staticUrl.split("//")
 		const apiUrl = staticUrlParts[0] + "//*.api." + staticUrlParts[1]
-		return `${env.staticUrl} ws${env.staticUrl.substring(4)} ${apiUrl} ${env.staticUrl.replace(/^https?/, "api")}`
+		const webSocketUrl = `ws${env.staticUrl.substring(4)}`
+		const appApiUrl = `${env.staticUrl.replace(/^https?/, "api")}`
+		const websiteUrl = env.staticUrl.includes("app.")
comment.body: we have website base url in domain config, why should we do this manipulation at all?

issue.title: Fix uncaught programming error, check for contact list id
issue.body:
It seems like it happens when users trigger the contact editor too early, probably because their security key is sending keyboard input.

Co-authored-by: ivk <ivk@tutao.de>

fix #5959

comment.body:
> > probably because their security key is sending keyboard input.
> 
> excuse me

Yes, some yubikeys will put in keyboard input (for some actually good reasons, see [here](https://support.yubico.com/hc/en-us/articles/360013790279-The-YubiKey-as-a-Keyboard)). You can try by just opening a text file and touching the key. Many people who reported this error mentioned they were logging in with 2fa, so we are most likely picking up on that text input and activating a shortcut. 

(I wanted to make this comment in the hope that it helps some poor soul in the future, because it is an odd situation.)

commits.message:
change tutanota.com references to tuta.com of the correct staging level

this includes csp for the app html, the support entries and policy docs

#5929

add tests and at event start option

#5637

add tests and at event start option

#5637

fix pinch zoom orientation change

The pinch zoom object needs to be recreated
at the right time after the orientation
of the device changes to consider the
right values for the calculation.
for detecting an orientation change of
the device we use a resize listener
on the mail-body / viewport.
The other resize listener on the
zoomable / mail is still needed e.g.
for image loading.

fix #6038
